title: Itâ€™s Not All About the Hearing Aid
chief_complaint: The patient reports that 'everyone else talks too fast, does not speak clearly, and mumbles.' He believes his family 'tells secrets' so he cannot hear them.

problem_summary.onset: Hearing loss has been present for over 15 years; significant subjective decline in the last 2 years.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Anger, frustration, suspicion/paranoia regarding family communication, social withdrawal.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Severe strain on marital and family relationships; patient only communicates effectively with his 9-year-old granddaughter.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Patient is resistant to new amplification, believing the issue is others mumbling. Wife wants comfortable TV volume and improved communication.

history.present_illness: Patient scheduled for follow-up due to continued difficulties despite wearing bilateral hearing aids (15 years total usage). Current aids are a 7-year-old BTE (Right) and 12-year-old BTE (Left). Reports significant conflict with wife and son regarding communication.
history.otologic_history: History of melanoma on the helix of the right pinna (removed); patient believes earmold caused it.
history.noise_exposure_history: History of noise exposure from years as a farmer.
history.medical_psych_history: Displays considerable anger and frustration; believes family is intentionally excluding him.
history.patient_goals: Initially stated he wanted to quit testing because 'it was a waste of time since I can't hear anything.'

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Moderately severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear and moderate to profound sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear. Symmetrical bone conduction thresholds indicate sensorineural nature.

numeric_results.Right_Thresholds: Slope from ~25 dB at 500Hz to ~80 dB at 4000Hz
numeric_results.Left_Thresholds: Slope from ~35 dB at 500Hz to ~80 dB at 4000Hz

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Word recognition scores (WRS) are very poor bilaterally, showing a significant decrease from the evaluation 2 years prior. Testing performed at reduced SL due to loudness recruitment.

tests.name: Immittance
tests.key_findings: Normal middle ear function bilaterally. Acoustic reflexes absent.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.key_findings: Clinician administered the Hearing Handicap Inventory for the Elderly (HHIE) and Client-Oriented Scale of Improvement (COSI) to assist in intervention planning.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with a bilateral, sloping, moderate-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss. Most notably, word recognition ability is extremely poor (20-24%), which is a significant decline from previous assessments and limits the potential benefit of amplification alone. Middle ear function is normal.
counseling_points: Acknowledge the frustration and anger you are feeling; these are common reactions to communication breakdown.
Your word recognition scores indicate that even when sound is loud enough, clarity is a major challenge.
Hearing aids alone will not solve the communication issues; we need a rehabilitation plan involving your family.
We recommend a communication training program (like LACE) and family counseling strategies before finalizing new devices.
It is important to rule out any medical contributors to the decline, given your history of melanoma.
notes_for_actor: Portray significant anger and defensiveness toward the clinician and family.
Insist that others are mumbling or whispering to keep secrets from you.
Show reluctance to participate in testing, claiming it is a waste of time.
Be dismissive of the idea that new hearing aids will help, citing mistrust of family communication.
